info.description:
The Bets API methods are used to place single, multiple and complex bets and to retrieve a customer’s bet history. When retrieving a customer’s bet history you can organize the bets from the betting history in terms of date, bet type and whether the bet is settled or not. You can also specify what fields to be included/excluded or return a list of all default fields the method returns.

The Bets API will also generate a bet delay if you’re placing a single/multiple bet in-Play by creating a time margin to negate the effects of major changes to the market (for example, goals during a football match). Note that in version 2 of our APIs, Bets API contains the functionality of both Bets API v1 and the Betslips API v1.

post.description: Places a single bet. When placing a single bet using live inplay bets, the system might generate a bet delay to allow a time margin to negate the effects of major changes (for example, goals) to the market. Note that the amount of bet delay will vary by category and event type. A delayedBetId will be recieved that can be used to resubmit the bet.

get.description: Retrieves the customer’s bet history. Options are available to organise the history in terms of date, bet type and settled and unsettled bets. The maximum number of bets and bet history pages retrieved can also be set.

parameters.description: A unique identifier of your application that is generated by the API portal.
parameters.name: apiKey

parameters.description: Another unique identifier for your application.
parameters.name: apiSecret

parameters.description: The ticket obtained from the sessions API
parameters.name: apiTicket

parameters.description: The identifier of the bet
parameters.name: betId

parameters.description: The cash in value of the bet
parameters.name: cashInValue

parameters.description: The ID of this bet delay
parameters.name: cashinBetDelayId

put.description: Allows a trusted application to cash in a bet (take a return on a bet) on behalf of the customer. If the customers monitor bets they can cash in a bet at any point before the event ends.
put.summary: Allows a trusted application to cash in a bet (take a return on a bet) on behalf of the customer

freeBetId.description: The ID number of the free bet token if used in conjunction with this bet

stake.description: The amount of the stake placed on the bet

typeCode.description: The bet type code of the bet. For example: TBL (Treble)

delayPeriodSeconds.description: The delay time period of the bet in seconds. The resubmission of the bet has to wait for the length of time (in seconds) returned in the delayPeriod before submitting the second request.

delayedBetId.description: The unique identifier of the delayed bet. After the initial response is received, containing the delayPeriod and the delayBetId, the request is then resubmitted using the same delayBetId token that came in that initial response. Check the example below to see how to resend a delayed bet payload.

number.description: Number of the bet if this is part of a multiple bet

numLines.description: The number of lines the bet consists of

number.description: Number of the bet if this is part of a multiple bet

placedDateTime.description: The time the bet was placed. For example: 2013-01-30TT13:34:20. The value of this element can be replaced with the current timestamp if it was missing.

receipt.description: The unique ID of the bet receipt

totalStake.description: The total amount staked on the bet

betMultiplier.description: The total aggregated odds, as a decimal, of the multiple bet placed

freeBets.description: Free bets that can be used with this bet

maxStake.description: Maximum stake allowable on the bet. For example: 2500.00 (GBP)

minStake.description: Minumum stake allowable on the bet. For example: 0.05 (GBP)

numLines.description: The number of lines (selections) of a bet

typeCode.description: The bet type code of the bet. For example: TBL (Treble)

typeName.description: The TypeCode of the bet. For example: TBL (Treble)

sort.description: The leg sort. This element is present for complex bets but not for single bets.

type.description: Type of leg that was placed on the bet, such as Win or Each-way. Even though the priceNum and priceDen are required for the bets with type value W (win), it is just optional from the endpoint point of view. There are requests / bets like outcomes with starting price but do not have a specific price. Generally prices can change, so if the type is win you have to resubmit and thus verify the price that the customer saw on the screen initially. The API will check if it matches the current price of William Hill. Note that if you send a wrong / outdated price you will receive the error message - Price changed.

eachWayAvailable.description: Indicates whether each way is available

includeInMultiple.description: Indicates if the bet can be used in a multiple bet

legGroup.description: To organise a number of outcome selections into one or more bet groups, such as a Single bet, a Double bet, a Trixie, etc

priceChanged.description: Indicates if there has been a change in the price

priceDen.description: Price denominator - will be ignored for types other than L (Fixed Price)

priceNum.description: Price numerator - will be ignored for types other than L (Fixed Price)

priceType.description: The type of price selected. For example - ‘L’ (Fixed)

singleAvailable.description: Indicates whether the bet can be used in a single bet

startingPriceAvailable.description: Indicates whether starting prices are available

status.description: Indicates the current status of the bet

statusChanged.description: Indicates whether the status of the bet has changed

success.description: Indicates whether the bet has been cashed-in.

code.description: A unique William Hill identifier for the error

field.description: To help pinpoint the exact parameter where a request has failed

message.description: A unique William Hill text string to enable you to identify the error (in English only)

awardDateTime.description: The time the free bet was awarded. For example 2014-11-013T23:59:10

displayText.description: The message explaining the offer displayed to the customer along with the free bet

expiryDateTime.description: The time the free bet expired. For example 2014-11-013T23:59:10

id.description: The identifier of the free bet

offerDesc.description: The description of the offer that enabled the customer to place a free bet

offerName.description: The name of the offer that enabled the customer to place a free bet

startDateTime.description: The time the free bet offer started. For example 2014-11-013T23:59:10

value.description: The value of the free bet

sort.description: The leg sort. This element is present for complex bets but not for single bets.

type.description: The leg type. One of the following values: W - Win or E- Each-way. Even though the priceNum and priceDen are required for the bets with type value W (win), it is just optional from the endpoint point of view. There are requests / bets like outcomes with starting price but do not have a specific price. Generally prices can change, so if the type is win you have to resubmit and thus verify the price that the customer saw on the screen initially. The API will check if it matches the current price of William Hill. Note that if you send a wrong / outdated price you will receive the error message - Price changed.

includeInMultiple.description: Indicates if the bet can be used in a multiple bet

priceDen.description: Price denominator - will be ignored for types other than L (Fixed Price)

priceNum.description: Price numerator - will be ignored for types other than L (Fixed Price)

priceType.description: The type of price selected. For example - ‘L’ (Fixed)

cashinValue.description: The cash in value of the bet. For example £0.88. When no value is given or no value is present, no cash in is available

estimatedReturns.description: The estimated value of the returns if the bet is successful. Note: when an estimated return isn’t available, as in the case of a bet placed on a horse at SP (starting price) where the actual price is unknown when the bet is placed, ‘NOT_AVAILABLE’ will appear in the response field.

freeBetValue.description: If a free bet token is used for the bet, this element represents the value

id.description: The unique identifier of the bet

numSelections.description: Number of selections that the bet is made of

receipt.description: The unique identifier of the receipt for the bet

stake.description: The bet stake, which represents the total value of the bet. For example: £ 12.34

stakePerLine.description: The individual stake on each line of the bet. For example: £ 6.17

status.description: The status of the bet. Can be one of the following: A - Active, S - suspended, C - Cashed Out

transDateTime.description: The time the bet was placed

typeCode.description: The bet type code of the bet. For example: TBL (Treble)

typeName.description: The name of the bet type. For example: Double

winnings.description: Actual value of the returns from this bet

number.description: The leg number of the bet

sort.description: The leg sort. This element is present for complex bets but not for single bets.

type.description: The leg type. One of the following values: W - Win or E- Each-way. Even though the priceNum and priceDen are required for the bets with type value W (win), it is just optional from the endpoint point of view. There are requests / bets like outcomes with starting price but do not have a specific price. Generally prices can change, so if the type is win you have to resubmit and thus verify the price that the customer saw on the screen initially. The API will check if it matches the current price of William Hill. Note that if you send a wrong / outdated price you will receive the error message - Price changed.

eachWayDen.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the denominator of the fraction. For example: 2 in 5/2

eachWayNum.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the numerator of the fraction. For example: 5 in 5/2

eachWayPlaces.description: The Each-way places available for the bet

eventMarketDescription.description: The description of the market within an event

eventTypeDescription.description: The description of type of the event

handicap.description: Denotes if the bet is part of a handicap market. For example: -1 if the selection starts on -1 goals (in football)

priceDen.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the denominator of the fraction. For example: 2 in 5/2

priceNum.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the numerator of the fraction. For example: 5 in 5/2

priceType.description: The price type chosen when the bet was placed. For example: L (Win)

result.description: The outcome of the bet/event. Can be one of the following values: W - Won; L - Lost; V - Void; - Result not yet available

rule4Deductions.description: The official scale of deductions that apply when a runner is withdrawn

startDateTime.description: Time the event will start. For example: 2013-01-30 11:01:01

decimal.description: The decimal format of the price

fractional.description: The fractional format of the price or EVS when the price evens.

freeBetId.description: The ID number of the free bet token if used in conjunction with this bet

priceDen.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the denominator of the fraction. For example: 2 in 5/2

priceNum.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the numerator of the fraction. For example: 5 in 5/2

priceType.description: The type of price taken by the customer when the bet is made. Can be one of the following: L - Live Fixed price, S - Starting price - Horse and Greyhound racing or G - Guaranteed best price.

selectionId.description: The unique ID for the selection of the bet

stake.description: The amount of the stake placed on the bet

type.description: The type of bet placed. Can be one of the following: W - Win or E- EachWay

priceDen.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the denominator of the fraction. For example: 2 in 5/2

priceNum.description: When the odds are shown in vulgar fractions this is the numerator of the fraction. For example: 5 in 5/2
